mobs.long_desc: The great leader of clan O'Connor glares at you.
mobs.desc: A heavily muscled man stands here, busy dictating orders to his subordinates. He looks rather important around here.

mobs.long_desc: The Chieftain of the Cameron clan stands resolutely here.
mobs.desc: The chieftain seems to be rather angry at something. He seems to want to break something. You'd better get out of the way.

mobs.long_desc: The chieftain of clan McLeod glares grimly at you.
mobs.desc: A middle aged man looks grim as he studies some maps. He seems to be rather upset at things.

mobs.long_desc: A warrior of clan O'Connor scans the horizon for danger.
mobs.desc: A rather young but strong young man leans on his spear, fatigued at the constant watchfulness placed upon his clan. He looks quite capable at fighting off danger from all quarters.

mobs.long_desc: A warrior of clan Cameron looks resolute in his duties.
mobs.desc: A brave young warrior glares into the distance, ever vigilant against intruders which would defile the honour of his clan.

mobs.long_desc: A warrior of clan McLeod looks haggard as he scans the horizon.
mobs.desc: The warrior, although young, seems to be quite tired and dejected. He seems to lament the poor luck of his clan in their on-going feud with the other clans.

mobs.long_desc: A robed man looks serene amidst the trees he guards.
mobs.desc: An elderly man stands here, quietly meditating on the beauty of the woods and the glory of nature. He looks rather frail but you can see that there is an aura of quiet authority about him.

mobs.long_desc: A druid is here, tending to the grove.
mobs.desc: A serene man dressed in simple, green robes walks through the woods, sprinking some sort of liquid on the ground. He seems to be quite intent on his task.

mobs.long_desc: A knight is here, stalking a fell creature.
mobs.desc: The knight is dressed in extremely shining armour, and has a resolute look on his face. He seems to be on a quest of some sort.

mobs.long_desc: A vicious wyvern glares at you from atop a rock.
mobs.desc: A horrible scaled beast, with a long, barbed tail and sharp teeth glares menacingly at you. You sense death about this creature.

mobs.long_desc: A wolf walks by, sniffing the air.
mobs.desc: A lean, muscular creature, the wolf seems to be happy just roaming in his territory.

mobs.long_desc: A beautiful woman sits among the branches.
mobs.desc: A beautiful woman with flowing green hair smiles sweetly at you.  The scent of wild flowers seems to permeate the air, and it seems to emanate from her.

mobs.long_desc: A horned creature is here, playing a pipe.
mobs.desc: A strange hybrid of a man and a goat, the satyr seems to taunt you with his songs and music. You get the urge to squish this beast.

mobs.long_desc: A centaur rides up and looks straight at you.
mobs.desc: A muscular centaur rides up to you and appraises your worth.  His eyes seems to bore into your soul.

mobs.keywords: eleweiss man green-cloaked cloaked tall ranger Questmaster
mobs.long_desc: A tall, green cloaked man rests against a branch here.
mobs.desc: Eleweiss is tall and slender.  His ears point upward towards the top branches of the tree in which he stands.  His deep eyes pierce anything he looks at, seeing truely to the heart of what is underneath.

mobs.long_desc: A beautiful woman sits amongst the branches.
mobs.desc: A beautiful woman with flowing green hair smiles sweetly at you. A scent of wild flowers seems to permeate the air, and it seems to emanate from her.

objects.ground: A heavy claymore is stuck in the ground.

extras.text: The claymore is a heavy broadsword but its craftsmanship is a little crude. You find that its balance is quite good and the blade is keen.

objects.ground: A long spear lies discarded here.

extras.text: The spear is consists of a large, iron head attached to a 6' shaft.  It is rather easy to use and would come in handy in a fight.

objects.ground: An intricately carved yew staff rests against a tree.

extras.text: A mystical aura surrounds this simple piece of wood. Although it seems to be a simple staff, there is something more about it that you just cannot put your finger on.

objects.ground: A light green potion lies among the grasses.

extras.text: You look at the messy green gunk in the crystal potion.  You wonder who would want to keep something like this.

objects.ground: A large quarterstaff is here.

extras.text: The staff is about 8 feet long and seems to be rather easy to use.  In the hands of an expert, this would be devastating.

objects.ground: A gold plated staff is stuck in the ground.

extras.text: The staff is made of wood, but there is an odd golden sheen to its surface.  A tingling sensation moves up your arm as you touch its surface.

objects.ground: A broadsword is half buried in the earth.

extras.text: The broadsword has the mark of a craftsman etched in its hilt.  The steel is of the finest quality and its balance superb.  This is truly the mark of a great warrior.
The mark on the hilt is of a hammer upon an anvil. Beneath it are the words: fiat justitia, ruat coelum Mystwatch

objects.ground: A small round shield is here.

extras.text: The buckler is just a small hide shield, about 1.  5 feet across.  It couldn't possibly give too much protection in a heated battle.

objects.ground: A cloak of wolf fur lies in a heap.

extras.text: The fur cloak is not very comfortable to wear but if it can protect you from the cold, well, you just aren't complaining.

objects.ground: A black wand is here.

extras.text: The wand is jet black in colour, and it seems to absorb all the light that falls on it. Etched on one end are the words: May the eyes never set their sights on me.

objects.ground: A heater shield lies here.

extras.text: The shield is of the design that knights usually use.  Upon it is the proud blazon of a gold eagle outspread upon a field of azure.

objects.ground: A leather hauberk lies on the ground.

extras.text: The hauberk is like a tunic with sleeves.  This one is a kind of long armored shirt that hangs above the knees providing protection to the torso.  It runs along the arms, under any additional armwear or sleeves.  It is collarless and split slightly at the center neck to allow the head through.  This one isn't very good but sometimes you just have to make do.

objects.ground: A reed pipe lies among the bushes.
objects.action_desc: The sound is wistful and somber.

extras.text: The pipe is made of reeds you'd normally find on river banks.  A haunting sound seems to emit from it as the wind blows past you.

objects.ground: A boar spear is here.

extras.text: The spear is about 8 feet long and has a cross bar about 2 feet from the point. This is to prevent the boar from climbing up the spear after it has been hit.

objects.ground: A horsehide shield lies here.

extras.text: The shield is a round hide shield about 4.  5 feet across.  The material it is made of has a rather strange texture.

objects.ground: A yellowed linen tunic lies in a heap.

extras.text: The tunic seems to be yellowed with age and constant use.  It is also rather threadbare in some spots.

objects.ground: A pile of cloth lies in heap.

extras.text: The pile of cloth seems to bear the markings of one of the highlander clans residing in the area.  This could be one of their philabegs or kilts they use to identify their loyalties.

objects.ground: A small bit of vine glows lightly here.

extras.text: A small circlet of glowing green vine, this vine although obviously cut from it's roots, still manages to survive throught some holy power.

objects.ground: A piece of bark with a picture on it lies here.
A piece of bark with a picture on it lies here.
A piece of bark with a picture on it lies here.
A piece of bark with a picture on it lies here.
A piece of bark with a picture on it lies here.
A silver flask shines in the light.

extras.text: This silver flask shines in the light.  The sound of water can be heard splashing around and if the cap is removed a holy glow eminates from the liquid within.

objects.ground: A piece of bark with a picture on it lies here.

triggers.name: quest_eleweiss_opening
triggers.commands: if %arg% /= scrape || %arg% /= mark || %arg% /= branch wsend %actor% A sudden gust of air catches hold of you, swirling around and moving you! wechoaround %actor% %actor.name% is swallowed by swirling air and disappears. wdoor 16374 up room 16375 wecho The wind whips around and around. wat 16375 wecho There is a sudden gust of wind. wat 16375 wecho %actor.name% is pushed in by the gust of wind which ceases promptly afterwards. wforce %actor% up wdoor 16374 up purge else return 0 endif

triggers.name: quest_eleweiss_ranger_druid_subclass_greet
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% eval minlevel (%wandstep% - 1) * 10 if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I see you're crafting something.  If you want my help, we can talk about &6&b[upgrades]&0.' else if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask1]% && %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask2]% && %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask3]% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Oh good, you're all set!  Let me see the staff.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you have what I need for the %weapon%?' endif endif endif endif switch %actor.race% *  case ADD NEW RESTRICTED RACES HERE *    halt *    break default if (%actor.class% /= Warrior && (%actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 25)) || (%actor.class% /= Cleric && (%actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 35)) if !%actor.quest_stage[ran_dru_subclass]% emote grins casually. msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Some know the ways of the woods, others are ignorant.  Do you know the &6&bways&0 or not?' emote puts a more serious look on his face. elseif %actor.quest_stage[ran_dru_subclass]% == 4 && !%actor.has_completed[ran_dru_subclass]% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Have you the jewel of the heart?' endif endif done

triggers.name: quest_eleweiss_ranger_druid_subclass_speak1
triggers.commands: if (%speech% /= ways || %speech% /= ways? || %speech% /= I know) && !%actor.quest_stage[ran_dru_subclass]% if %actor.class% /= Cleric switch %actor.race% *      case ADD NEW RESTRICTED RACES HERE *        if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 35 *          msend %actor% &1Your race may not subclass to druid.&0 *          halt *        endif *        break default wait 2 if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 35 if %use_subclass% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I'm currently assisting someone else, one moment please.' halt endif if (%actor.align% > -350 && %actor.align% < 350) smile %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you wish to join the ranks of the woodland healers with all the power there of?' set use_subclass Dru global use_subclass else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You are not properly aligned to be a woodland cleric.  Come back when you fix that.' endif elseif %actor.level% < 10 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Seek me again later when you have gained some more experience.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You have traveled too far on your current path to change your way.' endif done elseif %actor.class% /= Warrior switch %actor.race% *    case ADD NEW RESTRICTED RACES HERE *        if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 25 *          msend %actor% &1Your race may not subclass to ranger.&0 *          halt *        endif *        break default wait 2 if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 25 if %use_subclass% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I'm currently assisting someone else, one moment please.' halt endif if %actor.align% > 349 nod %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you wish to become a fighter who is one with the forests?' set use_subclass Ran global use_subclass else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Sorry, your alignment is not proper for what you wish to be.  Try again later.' endif elseif %actor.level% < 10 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Seek me again later when you have gained some more experience.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You have traveled too far on your current path to change your way.' endif done else wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I can do nothing for you, I am sorry.' emote smiles a little bit. endif endif

triggers.name: quest_eleweiss_ranger_druid_subclass_speak2
triggers.argument_list: yes yes? yes! no no? no!
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[ran_dru_subclass]% == 0 if %actor.class% /= Cleric *    case ADD NEW RESTRICTED RACES HERE *        if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 35 *          msend %actor% &1Your race may not subclass to druid.&0 *          halt *        endif *        break default if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 35 set classquest yes elseif %actor.level% < 10 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I cannot guide you yet.  Return to me when you have more experience.' elseif %actor.level% > 35 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You have traveled too far on your current path to change your way.' endif done elseif %actor.class% /= Warrior switch %actor.race% *    case ADD NEW RESTRICTED RACES HERE *        if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 25 *          msend %actor% &1Your race may not subclass to ranger.&0 *          halt *        endif *        break default if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 25 set classquest yes elseif %actor.level% < 10 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I cannot guide you yet.  Return to me when you have more experience.' elseif %actor.level% > 25 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You have traveled too far on your current path to change your way.' endif done endif endif wait 2 if %classquest% == yes if %speech% /= yes if !%use_subclass% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I cannot help until we talk about the ways of the woods.' halt endif quest start ran_dru_subclass %actor.name% %use_subclass% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Only the most dedicated to the forests shall complete the &6&bquest&0 I set upon you.  You may inquire about your &6&b[subclass progress]&0 or ask me to &6&b[repeat]&0 myself at any time.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Leave my sight, you tire me.' wave %actor.name% msend %actor% Eleweiss calls upon the air and moves you away. mechoaround %actor% Eleweiss removes %actor.name% from his presence. mteleport %actor% 16374 endif unset use_subclass endif

triggers.name: quest_eleweiss_ranger_druid_subclass_speak3
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[ran_dru_subclass]% == 1 quest advance ran_dru_subclass %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Yes, quest.  I do suppose it would help if I told you about it.' emote rubs his chin thoughtfully. wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Long ago I &6&blost something&0.  It is a shame, but it has never been recovered.' sigh msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'If you were to help me with that, then we could arrange something.' emote looks hopeful. endif

triggers.name: quest_eleweiss_ranger_druid_subclass_speak4
triggers.argument_list: something something? lost lost? it it? thing thing? what what?
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[ran_dru_subclass]% == 2 sigh msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'It seems I am becoming forgetful in my age.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Well, you see now, I lost the jewel of my heart.  If you are up to it, getting that and returning it to me will get you your reward.' shrug wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'But for now, it is time for you to depart I think.' sigh msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You have brought up painful memories for me to relive.' quest advance ran_dru_subclass %actor.name% endif

triggers.name: quest_eleweiss_ranger_druid_subclass_exit
triggers.commands: say Very well, goodbye little one. msend %actor% A gust of wind, commanded by Eleweiss, catches you and moves you away. mechoaround %actor% A gust of wind from Eleweiss moves %actor.name% away. mteleport %actor% 16374

triggers.name: quest_ranger_druid_subclass_heart_limiter
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[ran_dru_subclass]% == 3 quest advance ran_dru_subclass %actor.name% endif

triggers.name: quest_eleweiss_ranger_druid_subclass_receive
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[ran_dru_subclass]% == 4 emote throws back his head and howls loudly with pleasure. wait 3 shake %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You have done me a great service!  I cannot believe I have it back!' grin wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Type &2&b'subclass'&0 to proceed.' quest complete ran_dru_subclass %actor.name% else switch %actor.quest_stage[ran_dru_subclass]% case 1 case 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Woah, slow down, I have not even told you the quest yet!' break case 3 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'How on earth did you bring me the jewel of the heart without getting it yourself?' chuckle break default msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Nice little gift, thanks much.' emote tucks it into his cloak. wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Pity you were not on a quest for me, this could have been worth it for you.' done endif mjunk jewel

triggers.name: quest_eleweiss_ranger_druid_subclass_status
triggers.commands: wait 2 set halfelf half-elf set stage %actor.quest_stage[ran_dru_subclass]% switch %stage% case 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Only the most dedicated to the forests shall complete the &6&bquest&0 I set upon you.' break case 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Yes, quest. I do suppose it would help if I told you about it.' emote rubs his chin thoughtfully. wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Long ago I &6&blost something&0.  It is a shame, but it has never been recovered.' sigh msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'If you were to help me with that, then we could arrange something.' emote looks hopeful. break case 3 case 4 sigh msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'It seems I am becoming forgetful in my age.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Well, you see now, I lost the jewel of my heart. If you are up to it, finding and returning it to me will get you your reward.' shrug wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'But for now, it is time for you to depart I think.' sigh msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You have brought up painful memories for me to relive.' break default if %actor.class% /= Cleric switch %actor.race% *    case ADD NEW RESTRICTED RACES HERE *          if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 35 *            msend %actor% &1Your race may not subclass to druid.&0 *            halt *          endif *          break default if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 35 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You are not on this quest.' elseif %actor.level% < 10 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Seek me again later when you have gained some more experience.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You have traveled too far on your current path to change your way.' endif done elseif %actor.class% /= Warrior switch %actor.race% *    case ADD NEW RESTRICTED RACES HERE *          if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 25 *            msend %actor% &1Your race may not subclass to ranger.&0 *            halt *          endif *          break default if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 25 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You are not on this quest.' elseif %actor.level% < 10 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Seek me again later when you have gained some more experience.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You have traveled too far on your current path to change your way.' endif done endif done

triggers.name: Eleweiss refuse
triggers.commands: switch %object.vnum% case %wandgem% case %wandvnum% halt break default return 0 wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'What is this?' wait 3 msend %actor% %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I have no need of %object.shortdesc%.' done

triggers.name: dryad_moonwell_greet
triggers.commands: if (%actor.class% == druid) if (%actor.level% >= 73) switch (%actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]%) case 1 case 2 wait 5 if %actor.sex% == male msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Welcome back Brother.' elseif %actor.sex% == female msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Welcome back Sister.' endif wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Have you recovered the Vine of Mielikki?!  Please give it msend %actor% &0to me.' mechoaround %actor% %self.name% asks %actor.name% something. break case 3 wait 5 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Do you have the stone?  Please, give it to me!' smile %actor.name% mechoaround %actor% %self.name% asks %actor.name% something. break *line 20 case 4 case 5 wait 5 msend %actor% tells you, 'Do you have the flask?  Please give it to me if you do!' mechoaround %actor% %self.name% asks %actor.name% something. break case 6 wait 5 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Did you get the stone of power?  Please give it to me!' mechoaround %actor% %self.name% asks %actor.name% something. break case 7 wait 5 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Do you have the orb from the dark fortress?  Please give msend %actor% &0me the orb.' mechoaround %actor% %self.name% asks %actor.name% something. break case 8 case 9 wait 5 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'The second stone of power, you have it?  Please give it msend %actor% &0to me, we are almost complete!' mechoaround %actor% %self.name% asks %actor.name% something. break case 10 wait 5 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'The orb to balance the ritual, do you have it?  Please msend %actor% &0give me the orb!' mechoaround %actor% %self.name% asks %actor.name% something. break case 11 case 12 wait 5 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'The last stone of power, do you have it?  Please give me msend %actor% &0the last relic and we are finished!' mechoaround %actor% %self.name% asks %actor.name% something. break default wait 5 mecho %self.name% weeps lightly. wait 10 mechoaround %actor% %self.name% takes notice of %actor.name% and quickly wipes her tears. msend %actor% %self.name% takes notice of you and quickly wipes her tears. wait 5 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Hello fellow of the Order.' mechoaround %actor% %self.name% tells something to %actor.name%. wait 10 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'It is good to see a promising druid again.' mecho %self.name% smiles through her tears. done else wait 5 msend %actor% %self.name% looks you over and says, 'It is good to see a druid again, but you msend %actor% &0have not yet seen enough of the world to help me.  Please come back when you msend %actor% &0are more experienced.' *line 80 mechoaround %actor% %self.name% tells %actor.name% something. endif endif

triggers.name: dryad_random
triggers.commands: whine

triggers.name: dryad_moonwell_again
triggers.commands: * * Created by Acerite Oct, 2004 * Check to see if Actor is eligible, then set their name in the global moon_name for future trigger. * if (%actor.class% == druid) if (%actor.level% >= 73) set moon_name %actor.name% global moon_name wait 5 sigh wait 10 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Yes, well...' mechoaround %actor% %self.name% tells something to %actor.name%. wait 5 mecho %self.name% starts to reminisce about her past. wait 5 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'You see, I was not always like this.  Many years ago I msend %actor% &0too was a young mortal druid.  But while on my journeys I made a grave error in msend %actor% &0judgement.' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I rediscovered powerful magics that allowed me to travel msend %actor% &0the world on a whim.' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'But I squandered that magic on frivolous desires and msend %actor% &0furthering my own ambitions, rather than using it to better perform my sworn msend %actor% &0duties.' wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Thus the great goddess Mielikki punished me by binding me msend %actor% &0to this tree as a dryad so I might never travel again.' wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Now, if I do not perform my duties properly, I ensure my msend %actor% &0own death.' mechoaround %actor% %self.name% tells her story to %actor.name%. wait 7s sigh wait 5 ponder wait 5 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'But perhaps if I repent by teaching you these ancient msend %actor% &0magics, the goddess will release me from this place!' wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Yes, if you are willing I will teach you the power of msend %actor% &0druidic travel.' mechoaround %actor% %self.name% seems excited while telling something to %actor.name%. wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Are you willing to learn?' endif endif

triggers.name: dryad_moonwell_yesno
triggers.commands: * *Created By Acerite Oct, 2004 *Okay we check to see if the same person that we've been talking to is the one responding *Then we free the variable * if (%actor.name% == %moon_name%) unset moon_name if (%speech% /=no) frown msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Very well, that is your choice.' mechoaround %actor% %self.name% seems disappointed as she says something to %actor.name%. endif if (%speech% /= yes) mecho %self.name% smiles with a slight twinkle in her eye. wait 5 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Very well, I will teach you what I know.' mechoaround %actor% %self.name% seems pleased as she speaks with %actor.name%. wait 20 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you 'I will guide you through the proper performance of a msend %actor% &0complex ceremony to create a well of moonlight.' wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'This ceremony requires several powerful symbols and msend %actor% &0materials.  You must attain these materials since I cannot leave this place.' mechoaround %actor% %self.name% excitedly tells %actor.name% something. wait 5 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'First we need something to mark the well's outline.' mechoaround %actor% %self.name% begins telling something to %actor.name%. wait 5 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Long ago during the Rift Wars, the goddess Mielikki was msend %actor% &0injured by another god, and one of the vines that surround her body was cut msend %actor% &0off.  As this was more than a mere plant but rather part of Her divine body, it msend %actor% &0survived.' wait 6s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I have heard tell this vine has proliferated near molten msend %actor% &0mountains, but is guarded by fearsome fiery beasts.' wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Go, recover part of this vine and bring it back safely!' mechoaround %actor% %self.name% pleads with %actor.name% desperately. quest start moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% endif endif

triggers.name: vine_got
triggers.commands: if (%actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% == 1) if %got_vine% == 1 oecho The Vine of Mielikki glows brightly then fades...its holy glow fading. return 0 else quest advance moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% endif endif

triggers.name: chimera_load
triggers.commands: say My trigger commandlist is not complete!

triggers.name: tri-asp_load
triggers.commands: if (%actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% ==4) mjunk flask mload obj 16356 end if

triggers.name: got_flask
triggers.commands: if (%actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% == 4) if %got_flask% == 1 oecho Eleweiss' Flask grows dark as its power fades. return 0 else quest advance moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% endif elseif set got_flask 1 global got_flask endif

triggers.name: jade_got
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% == 8 quest advance moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% oecho %self.shortdesc% begins to glow mysteriously. endif

triggers.name: create_moonwell
triggers.commands: wload obj 33

triggers.name: Moonwell Vine Receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% == 1 wait 2 mjunk vine msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'How did you get this?  No, go get it yourself.' elseif %actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% == 2 wait 2 mjunk vine quest advance moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Very good.  I can now lay out the well's boundaries.' wait 10 mecho %self.name% places the vine in a small circle on the ground. smile %actor.name% wait 10 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Excellent.  Now we must have stone.  Of course there is msend %actor% &0plenty of stone here, but we need to have a stone with significant energy to msend %actor% &0act as a magical anchor point.' wait 15 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Far to the north there is an ancient burial site.  Within msend %actor% &0its catacombs lays a stone of great power, shaped like a heart.  Obtain this msend %actor% &0stone and it will surely increase our well's power.' wait 5 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Go now while I continue construction of our well.' wait 20 mecho %self.name% begins to collect some rocks and place them around the vine circle. endif

triggers.name: moonwell_quest_status_checker
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.has_completed[moonwell_spell_quest]% say I have already taught you to travel through moonwells. halt endif set stage %actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% switch %stage% case 1 case 2 * Vine of Mielikki set item 16350 set place an island of lava and fire. break case 3 * The Heartstone set item 48024 set place an ancient burial site far to the north break case 4 * Flask of Eleweiss set item 16356 set place the cult of the ice dragon break case 5 * Flask of Eleweiss set item 16356 set place the cult of the ice dragon break case 6 * Glittering ruby ring set item 5201 set place a temple dedicated to fire break case 7 * Orb of Winds set item 16006 set place a dark fortress to the east break case 8 * update map say Please give me your map to update. halt break case 9 * Jade ring set item 49011 set place a wood nymph on an island of our brothers beset by beasts break case 10 * Chaos Orb set item 4003 set place a great dragon hidden in a hellish labyrinth break case 11 * Granite Ring set item 55020 set place a large temple hidden in a mountain break case 12 * update diagram say Please give me your map to make the final markings. halt break default say You haven't agreed to help me yet. halt done say We need: mecho &0%get.obj_shortdesc[%item%]% from mecho &0%place%. if %stage% > 6 mecho mecho %self.name% says, 'If you need a new map, say "&2&bI lost my map&0".' endif

triggers.name: moonwell_dryad_map_replacement
triggers.commands: wait 2 set stage %actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% if %stage% > 6 sigh say It will be difficult to complete this ritual without it. wait 1s emote begins to draw a new map. wait 2s emote continues to draw... wait 2s emote continues to draw... wait 4s say There!  All set! wait 1s switch %stage% case 8 mload obj 16352 break case 9 case 10 mload obj 16353 break case 11 mload obj 16354 break case 12 mload obj 16355 break case 7 default mload obj 16351 break done give map %actor.name% endif

triggers.name: Moonwell Heartstone receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% == 3 wait 2 quest advance moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Very good! This will work perfectly as an anchor stone.' mecho %self.name% places %object.shortdesc% in the center of the well's outline. mjunk jewel wait 15 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Back when I was still mortal, I frequently traveled with msend %actor% &0Eleweiss, a ranger of great skill and magical acumen.  We once ventured north msend %actor% &0into the frozen mountains, and came across a cult that worshipped a msend %actor% &0particularly nasty white dragon.  Due to some unfortunate circumstances, we msend %actor% &0ended up having to battle the dragon and were forced to retreat.' wait 20 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'In our retreat, Eleweiss lost a flask which contained msend %actor% &0water blessed by the Goddess Herself.  That water would be ideal for our magic msend %actor% &0well.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I imagine the flask is the kind of thing a dragon would msend %actor% &0add to its treasure hoard.  Please take revenge for us and obtain the flask.' endif

triggers.name: Moonwell Flask Receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% == 4 wait 2 mjunk flask msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'How did you get this?  No no, go get it yourself.' elseif %actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% == 5 wait 2 mjunk flask quest advance moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Thank you, thank you.' wait 15 mecho %self.name% opens the flask and pours the water into the boundary of the well while reciting a prayer to Mielikki. wait 4 mecho The boundary of the well becomes translucent and starts to glow! wait 15 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Okay now we need some items of power to place around the msend %actor% &0outside edge of the well.' wait 15 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Each needs to be either an orb or circle to reflect the msend %actor% &0circular boundary of the well itself.' wait 15 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'The first item shall be a ring representing Fire.  Fire msend %actor% &0is most closely associated with rubies, so a ruby ring would be good.  One from msend %actor% &0a place connected with fire would be ideal!' wait 5 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Oh, before you leave.  Here takes this.' mload obj 16351 give map %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'That will help you keep track of everything.' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Now go!' endif

triggers.name: Moonwell Ruby Receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% == 6 wait 2 quest variable moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% map 1 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Good.  Thank you!' wait 15 mecho %self.name% places %object.shortdesc% along the circumference of the circle and utters a prayer. wait 1s mecho %object.shortdesc% starts flickering with sparking lights! wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Now that we have the first symbol, we can go for the msend %actor% &0second.  The second item we need is an orb, representing the element of Air. msend %actor% &0This orb is somewhere in a dark fortress to the east.  Please obtain the orb.' wait 15 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Oh wait, please allow me to update your map.' mjunk %object% endif

triggers.name: Moonwell Map 1 Receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% == 6 if %actor.quest_variable[moonwell_spell_quest:map]% == 1 quest advance moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% quest variable moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% map 0 wait 2 mjunk map mload obj 16352 wait 15 mecho %self.name% quickly marks something on the bark map. give map %actor.name% wait 5 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'There you go!' else return 0 shake mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I need the ring first.' endif endif

triggers.name: Moonwell Winds Receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% == 7 wait 2 quest variable moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% map 1 wait 15 mecho %self.name% places %object.shortdesc% along the circumference of the circle and utters a prayer. wait 1s mecho %object.shortdesc% begins to swirl like the howling winds! wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'We're making good progress.' wait 15 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Now that you have obtained the second element, please let msend %actor% &0me mark your map.' mjunk orb endif

triggers.name: Moonwell Map 2 Receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% == 7 if %actor.quest_variable[moonwell_spell_quest:map]% == 1 quest advance moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% quest variable moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% map 0 wait 15 mjunk map mload obj 16353 mecho %self.name% marks something on the bark map. wait 15 give map %actor.name% wait 5 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Okay, the third element in this ritual is Water.  In msend %actor% &0magic, water is often represented by jade.' wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I know of a jade ring held by a wood nymph on an island msend %actor% &0where other members of our Order are beset by beasts.' wait 4s msend %actor% &0But be careful, for 'tis a dangerous place for the unprepared!' else return 0 shake mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I need the orb first.' endif endif

triggers.name: Moonwell Jade Receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% == 9 quest variable moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% map 1 wait 5 mecho %self.name% places %object.shortdesc% along the circumference of the circle and utters a prayer. wait 1s mecho %object.shortdesc% dissipates into a circle of undulating soft blue-green light. wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Good.  Please give me your map so I may update it.' mjunk ring endif

triggers.name: Moonwell Map 3 Receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% == 9 if %actor.quest_variable[moonwell_spell_quest:map]% == 1 quest advance moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% quest variable moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% map 0 wait 2 mjunk map wait 15 mload obj 16354 mecho %self.name% quickly marks another check on the bark map. wait 15 give map %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Okay, there are two items left.  This next might seem msend %actor% &0odd, but we need a single item of evil and chaos to mislead forces that wish to msend %actor% &0harm us while traveling through the well.' wait 5s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'There is an orb that will serve this function well.  But msend %actor% &0as with so many such powerful relics, it is guarded by a great dragon hidden in msend %actor% &0a hellish labyrinth.' wait 5s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Get this orb that we might protect ourselves!' else return 0 shake mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I need the ring first.' endif endif

triggers.name: Moonwell Chaos Receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% == 10 wait 2 quest variable moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% map 1 wait 10 mecho %self.name% places %object.shortdesc% along the circumference of the circle and utters a prayer. wait 1s mecho %object.shortdesc% crackles and shatters, shooting streaks of red lightning around the periphery of the well. wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Please give me the map to update!' mjunk orb endif

triggers.name: Moonwell Map 4 Receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% == 10 if %actor.quest_variable[moonwell_spell_quest:map]% == 1 quest advance moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% quest variable moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% map 0 wait 2 mjunk map wait 15 mload obj 16355 mecho %self.name% marks something on the bark map. wait 15 give map %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Lastly, we need the item for the Earth.  There is a ring msend %actor% &0made of mundane stone kept in a large temple hidden in a mountain.  Obtain this msend %actor% &0final ring and we can finish this ceremony.' else return 0 shake mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I need the orb first.' endif endif

triggers.name: Moonwell Granite Receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% == 11 wait 2 mjunk ring quest variable moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% map 1 wait 15 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Excellent, hand me your map so that I may finish this.' endif

triggers.name: Moonwell Map 5 Receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% == 11 if %actor.quest_variable[moonwell_spell_quest:map]% == 1 wait 15 mjunk map mload obj 16366 mecho %self.name% completes her drawing on the bark map. wait 15 give map %actor.name% if %actor.sex% == female msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Keep that map Sister, that you may never forget how to msend %actor% &0conduct this ceremony.' else msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Keep that map Brother, that you may never forget how to msend %actor% &0conduct this ceremony.' endif wait 20 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Let us finish the ceremony.' mecho %self.name% places %get.obj_shortdesc[55020]% at the edge of the circle and prays. wait 5 mecho &5A &0moonwell &5appears at %self.name%'s feet!&0 wait 20 mecho &6&bThe moonwell beings to &5&bswirl&0! wait 25 * mecho &5A swirling &0moonwell &5appears at %self.name%'s feet!&0 m_run_room_trig 16348 wait 30 mecho A soft yet loud voice says, 'You have done well young dryad.  Perhaps you truly mecho &0are repentant.  For your service, I release you from your shackles.' wait 10 mecho The voice says, 'Remember this always.' wait 15 mecho A bright flash of light pierces the area and the dryad is transformed into a beautiful mortal woman! wait 10 mecho The beautiful druid says, 'Thank you my Goddess, Mielikki!  At last, I am free mecho &0again!' wait 2s mecho The beautiful druid bows deeply, enters the moonwell and disappears! quest complete moonwell_spell_quest %actor.name% mskillset %actor.name% moonwell mpurge %self% else return 0 shake mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I need the ring first.' endif endif

triggers.name: Moonwell receive decline
triggers.commands: set stage %actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% if ((%stage% == 1 || %stage% == 2 || %stage% == 3) && %object.vnum% == 16350) halt elseif ((%stage% == 3 || %stage% == 4) && %object.vnum% == 48024) halt elseif ((%stage% == 4 || %stage% == 5 || %stage% == 6) && %object.vnum% == 16356) halt elseif (%stage% == 6 && %object.vnum% == 5201) halt elseif (%stage% == 7 && (%object.vnum% == 16006 || %object.vnum% == 16351)) halt elseif %stage% == 8 && %object.vnum% == 16352 halt elseif %stage% == 9 && %object.vnum% == 49011 halt elseif %stage% == 10 && (%object.vnum% == 4003 || %object.vnum% == 16353) halt elseif (%stage% == 11 && (%object.vnum% == 55020 || %object.vnum% == 16354 || %object.vnum% == 16355)) halt else return 0 wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I do not want this from you.' msend %actor% %self.name% returns your item to you. endif

rooms.name: Worn Path
rooms.description: Far to the north, you see tall, rocky crags stand out from a sea of mist, majestically surveying the land all around.  A light mist clings to the ground, dampening the sounds of your footsteps.  You stand upon a path on high ground, leading towards the north and into the highlands.  What adventures await you here?

rooms.name: Low Ridge
rooms.description: You walk along a rise just to the west of the path.  To the west, dense forests block your path in that direction.  To the north, you see a deer path going deeper into the woods.  Above extends a mighty oak tree, standing tall and firm.

rooms.name: Worn Path
rooms.description: The path continues towards the north, into this land of mist and mystery. Far in the distance, you can hear shrill whistles and drum-beats resounding in the air.  There is a low ridge to the west which looks like it could be easily scaled.

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: You walk among the crude dwellings inside the fort compound.  The inhabitants seem to be in a constant state of war.  Almost everybody seem to be carrying arms of some sort, even young children.

rooms.name: Council Chamber
rooms.description: You find yourself in the council chamber of the clan.  Banners and tapestries decorate the walls, all testaments of the glory of the clan.  A large table dominates the room.  It is obviously where the clan elders meet to rule the clan.

rooms.name: Deer Path
rooms.description: You walk upon a narrow path which leads deeper into the woods.  Behind you, you can still see the relatively brighter rise near the path.  The trail continues towards the north and get progressively more difficult to see.

rooms.name: Bend In The Road
rooms.description: You have come to a sharp south-east bend in the path.  The ridge has become unscalable to the east and it continues on to the north.  You can see rather dense woods beyond the rise.

rooms.name: Bend In The Path
rooms.description: The path now bends in a north-west direction.  To the north, it continues to meander all acrosss the land.  Far to the north you can see the tall crags of a great mountain range.  Down in the valley, a vast tract of forest cover the ground.

rooms.name: Mountain Pass
rooms.description: You find yourself at the top of a mountain pass.  To the north, a large rock outcropping looms above you.  The air here somehow feels a little drier and warmer.  A cool breeze blows from the south towards the rock outcropping.  It might be possible to scale it to see what is on the other side.

rooms.name: Mountain Pass
rooms.description: A cool breeze continues to blow to the west, bringing wisps of mist from the cool lands just a little way to the east.  The land seems to be getting greener and greener as the trail extends towards that direction.

rooms.name: Bend In The Mountain Path
rooms.description: The path bends to the south and to the east.  The air seems to be much cooler to the south.  Tendrils of mist wafts past you.

rooms.name: Mountain Path
rooms.description: You are on a north-south path leading to the mountain range to the north. The air here is cool and pleasant, the mist which clings to the ground gives this place an air of mystery and adventure.  Welcome to the Highlands.

rooms.name: Hill Path
rooms.description: The path bends in a north-east direction.  There are signs of habitation to the east, and the valley is to the north.

rooms.name: Outside The Palisade
rooms.description: You stand outside the gates of a wooden palisade surrounding a village. There seems to be quite a lot of fighting occuring here, as you can see traces of previous fires and pock marks on the logs.  The trail continues on towards the west.  The proud banner of Clan McLeod is raised on a pole just at the gateway.

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: You find yourself in the courtyard, behind the wooden palisade.  Crude, wooden huts are scattered all around, and it seems like there was no planning when it was being built.  All sorts of livestock are wandering in the compound. An important looking structure seems to dominate the south-eastern end of this place.

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: You walk among the crude dwellings inside the fort compound.  The inhabitants seem to be in a constant state of war.  Almost everybody seem to be carrying arms of some sort, even young children.

rooms.name: The Oak Tree
rooms.description: You come to a clearing in the middle of the woods.  Prominent in the centre of this clearing is a large oak tree.  There seems to be a strange aura here, but you just can't put your finger on what exactly it is.  Small paths lead to the north, east and south.

extras.text: The tree looks almost as old as the woods itself. You feel rather comfortable under its shade. A cool breeze seems to keep blowing here.

rooms.name: Dark Woods
rooms.description: You find yourself in the deep woods, and it's dark too.  The sheer thickness of the foliage above you totally shields the sun from this place.  The thick undergrowth makes passage somewhat difficult.  Wisps of mist float past, giving an eerie feel to this place.

rooms.name: Worn Path
rooms.description: You stand at the top of the hill, looking down into a valley.  The road continues north to meet in a junction far below.  The road leads back into the mountains towards the south.

rooms.name: The Hills
rooms.description: You stroll along the gently rolling hills that are spread along this land. Below you, you see a worn trail meander down the valley in a roughly east-west direction.  Far to the north, a dense forest covers the ground.  Beyond that, tall mountains stands majestically, a barrier to any passage to the lands beyond.

rooms.name: The Hills
rooms.description: You stroll along the gently rolling hills that are spread along this land. Below you, you see a worn trail meander down the valley in a roughly east-west direction.  Far to the north, a dense forest covers the ground.  Beyond that, tall mountains stands majestically, a barrier to any passage to the lands beyond.

rooms.name: The Hills
rooms.description: You stroll along the gently rolling hills that are spread along this land. Below you, you see a worn trail meander down the valley in a roughly east-west direction.  Far to the north, a dense forest covers the ground.  Beyond that, tall mountains stands majestically, a barrier to any passage to the lands beyond.

rooms.name: The Hills
rooms.description: You stroll along the gently rolling hills that are spread along this land. Below you, you see a worn trail meander down the valley in a roughly east-west direction.  Far to the north, a dense forest covers the ground.  Beyond that, tall mountains stands majestically, a barrier to any passage to the lands beyond.

rooms.name: Hill Path
rooms.description: The path leads in a north-south direction.  To the north, lies the valley. A road can be seen down there.  To the south, the path continues on into the hills.

rooms.name: Dark Woods
rooms.description: You find yourself in the deep woods, and it's dark too.  The sheer thickness of the foliage above you totally shields the sun from this place.  The thick undergrowth makes passage somewhat difficult.  Wisps of mist float past, giving an eerie feel to this place.

rooms.name: Dark Woods
rooms.description: You find yourself in the deep woods, and it's dark too.  The sheer thickness of the foliage above you totally shields the sun from this place.  The thick undergrowth makes passage somewhat difficult.  Wisps of mist float past, giving an eerie feel to this place.

rooms.name: Dark Woods
rooms.description: You find yourself in the deep woods, and it's dark too.  The sheer thickness of the foliage above you totally shields the sun from this place.  The thick undergrowth makes passage somewhat difficult.  Wisps of mist float past, giving an eerie feel to this place.

rooms.name: T Junction
rooms.description: You come to a t-junction at the bottom of the valley.  Paths lead to the north, south and east.  Hills surround you on all sides.

rooms.name: Worn Path
rooms.description: The path continues in an east-west direction, flanked by the forest on the northern side and hills on the south.  It looks like it is possible to climb the hills above.

rooms.name: Worn Path
rooms.description: The path continues in an east-west direction, flanked by the forest on the northern side and hills on the south.  It looks like it is possible to climb the hills above.

rooms.name: Worn Path
rooms.description: The path continues in an east-west direction, flanked by the forest on the northern side and hills on the south.  It looks like it is possible to climb the hills above.

rooms.name: Worn Path
rooms.description: The path continues in an east-west direction, flanked by the forest on the northern side and hills on the south.  It looks like it is possible to climb the hills above.

rooms.name: T-Junction
rooms.description: The road comes to a T-shaped junction here.  One path leads southward, into the hills.  One way runs to the east, also through the hills, and the other, just a little narrow path, runs westward.  A large oak tree overlooks the junction, standing just to the north.

rooms.name: Hill Road
rooms.description: The path leads on towards the north and up into the hills.  You notice quite a lot of scorch marks on the ground, as if this place keeps getting burnt down. There also seem to be quite a lot of arrowheads scattered on the ground.

rooms.name: Council Chamber
rooms.description: You find yourself in the council chamber of the clan.  Banners and tapestries decorate the walls, all testaments of the glory of the clan.  A large table dominates the room.  It is obviously where the clan elders meet to rule the clan.

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: You find yourself in the courtyard, behind the wooden palisade.  Crude, wooden huts are scattered all around, and it seems like there was no planning when it was being built.  All sorts of livestock are wandering in the compound. An important looking structure seems to dominate the west end of this place.

rooms.name: Outside The Palisade
rooms.description: You stand outside the gates of a wooden palisade surrounding a village. There seems to be quite a lot of fighting occuring here, as you can see traces of previous fires and pock marks on the logs.  The trail continues on towards the west.  The proud banner of Clan O'Connor is raised on a pole just at the gateway.  A small dirt path leads north a short way from the gate.

rooms.name: Worn Path
rooms.description: You stand at the top of the hill, looking down into a valley.  The path bends towards the east and down the valley to the south.  There seems to be signs of human habitation just further up the road.

rooms.name: The Oak Tree
rooms.description: The tree grows on a low rise, so that it is just overlooking the road. Strangely, you feel rather odd here, as if there is something here that you just can't put your finger on.

extras.text: The tree looks almost as old as the woods itself. You feel rather comfortable under its shade. A cool breeze seems to keep blowing here.

rooms.name: Forest Trail
rooms.description: A small trail meanders in a north-south direction towards the deep woods. Although this path is rather well concealed, it shows signs that it is used rather often.  Tall trees block your way on both sides of the trail.

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: You walk among the crude dwellings inside the fort compound.  The inhabitants seem to be in a constant state of war.  Almost everybody seem to be carrying arms of some sort, even young children.

rooms.name: Forest Road
rooms.description: The road leads northwards towards the mountain range far to the north. Thick forests flank the road to the east and west.  You are able to walk into the woods from here.

rooms.name: Forest
rooms.description: Tall trees surrounds you at all sides, making it rather dark and difficult to see.  The growls of the denizens of this forest can be heard occasionally, but they seem to be quite far away, for now that is.

rooms.name: Hill Road
rooms.description: The path leads on towards the north and up into the hills.  You notice quite a lot of scorch marks on the ground, as if this place keeps getting burnt down. There also seem to be quite a lot of arrowheads scattered on the ground.

rooms.name: Forest
rooms.description: The forest is very dense and dark.  Thick underbrush hinders your efforts in walking through this terrain.  Occasionally, you can hear the growls of animals in the distance.

rooms.name: Forest
rooms.description: The forest is very dense and dark.  Thick underbrush hinders your efforts in walking through this terrain.  Occasionally, you can hear the growls of animals in the distance.

rooms.name: Forest
rooms.description: The forest is very dense and dark.  Thick underbrush hinders your efforts in walking through this terrain.  Occasionally, you can hear the growls of animals in the distance.

rooms.name: Hill Road
rooms.description: The path leads on towards the north and up into the hills.  You notice quite a lot of scorch marks on the ground, as if this place keeps getting burnt down. There also seem to be quite a lot of arrowheads scattered on the ground.

rooms.name: Forest
rooms.description: Tall trees surrounds you at all sides, making it rather dark and difficult to see.  The growls of the denizens of this forest can be heard occasionally, but they seem to be quite far away, for now that is.

rooms.name: Forest Road
rooms.description: The road leads northwards.  There is a mountain range far to the north. Thick forests flank the road to the east and west.  You are able to walk into the woods from here.

rooms.name: The Oak Tree
rooms.description: You come to a clearing in the middle of the woods.  Prominent in the centre of this clearing is a large oak tree.  There seems to be a strange aura here, but you just can't put your finger on what exactly it is.  Small paths lead to the north, west and south.

extras.text: The tree looks almost as old as the woods itself. You feel rather comfortable under its shade. A cool breeze seems to keep blowing here.

rooms.name: Forest
rooms.description: The forest is very dense and dark.  Thick underbrush hinders your efforts in walking through this terrain.  Occasionally, you can hear the growls of animals in the distance.

rooms.name: The Sacred Grove
rooms.description: You are on a low hill, surrounded by many menhirs arranged in a circle.  In the middle of this circle is a large stone altar.  A distance of 100 yards separates the forest from the edge of the stone circle.  Planted at the eight compass points are oak trees.  There is a subtle aura of power here.

extras.text: The stone blocks are at least 35 feet high and made of granite. They are well spaced to form a perfect circle around the hill.
The altar is a perfectly square granite block. There seems to be some scorch marks on it. It also feels cold to the touch.

rooms.name: Forest
rooms.description: The forest is very dense and dark.  Thick underbrush hinders your efforts in walking through this terrain.  Occasionally, you can hear the growls of animals in the distance.

rooms.name: Outside The Palisade
rooms.description: You stand outside the gates of a wooden palisade surrounding a village. There seems to be quite a lot of fighting occuring here, as you can see traces of previous fires and pock marks on the logs.  The trail continues on towards the north and south.  The proud banner of Clan Cameron is raised on a pole just at the gateway.

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: You find yourself in the courtyard, behind the wooden palisade.  Crude, wooden huts are scattered all around, and it seems like there was no planning when it was being built.  All sorts of lifestock are wandering in the compound. An important looking structure seems to dominate the north-eastern end of this place.

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: You walk among the crude dwellings inside the fort compound.  The inhabitants seem to be in a constant state of war.  Almost everybody seem to be carrying arms of some sort, even young children.

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: You walk among the crude dwellings inside the fort compound.  The inhabitants seem to be in a constant state of war.  Almost everybody seems to be carrying arms of some sort, even young children.

rooms.name: Forest
rooms.description: Tall trees surrounds you at all sides, making it rather dark and difficult to see.  The growls of the denizens of this forest can be heard occasionally, but they seem to be quite far away, for now that is.

rooms.name: Forest Road
rooms.description: The road leads northwards.  There is a mountain range far to the north. Thick forests flank the road to the east and west.  You are able to walk into the woods from here.

rooms.name: Forest
rooms.description: Tall trees surrounds you at all sides, making it rather dark and difficult to see.  The growls of the denizens of this forest can be heard occasionally, but they seem to be quite far away, for now that is.

rooms.name: Forest
rooms.description: The forest is very dense and dark.  Thick underbrush hinders your efforts in walking through this terrain.  Occasionally, you can hear the growls of animals in the distance.

rooms.name: Forest
rooms.description: The forest is very dense and dark.  Thick underbrush hinders your efforts in walking through this terrain.  Occasionally, you can hear the growls of animals in the distance.

rooms.name: Forest
rooms.description: The forest is very dense and dark.  Thick underbrush hinders your efforts in walking through this terrain.  Occasionally, you can hear the growls of animals in the distance.

rooms.name: Hill Road
rooms.description: You have come to a rather small road, leading on towards the north.  The highlands are to the south.  What awaits you further along this little path?

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: You walk among the crude dwellings inside the fort compound.  The inhabitants seem to be in a constant state of war.  Almost everybody seem to be carrying arms of some sort, even young children.

rooms.name: Council Chamber
rooms.description: You find yourself in the council chamber of the clan.  Banners and tapestries decorate the walls, all testaments of the glory of the clan.  A large table dominates the room.  It is obviously where the clan elders meet to rule the clan.

rooms.name: Hill Road
rooms.description: You have come to a rather small road, leading on towards the south.  The road begins to bend towards the east and to more open ground.

rooms.name: Hill Road
rooms.description: The road leads on to the east.  A large building looms in the distance. Maple and oak trees line the road and are scattered across the hillside.  A few small structures are clustered to the south.

rooms.name: Hill Road
rooms.description: The road leads on to the east.  There seem to be very little of interest along the way.  The dirt road leads east-west through the oak-studded hills. A looming structure sits some distance to the east, while small buildings are gathered to the south.  A dusty wind blows through, coating the grass with brown dirt.  There are many footprints along this road.

extras.text: All manner of prints are here: sandals, boots, and horses.  Scattered among these are some prints that appear to be from wolves, and also, some large clawed prints of strange origin.  Oddly, some of the hoofprints are not shod, though they keep to the road like all the rest.

rooms.name: A Tall Oak Tree
rooms.description: The lower branches of the tree are all around.  The ground is far below, and the trunk is thick and steady.  Some of the smaller branches shuffle in any little breeze, causing their leaves to twirl around.  There is a small scrape mark on a branch nearby.

extras.text: It almost looks like it is worn from being walked on frequently.

rooms.name: An Extended Branch in an Oak Tree
rooms.description: At this point in the large oak tree, even the most firm and large branches sway a little in even a gentle wind.  Below the ground is nearly hidden and there is no way anyone from down there could see this high.  The green leaves are a wonderful cover, allowing much to go on hidden.

rooms.name: Hill Road
rooms.description: A simple dirt road meanders through the hills.  It turns north here, running near the side of a large building to the east.  It is simple and weatherworn, but well-tended.  The road also leads west among the scattered trees.

rooms.name: Hill Road
rooms.description: A dusty road begins here, or ends, depending on the traveller's perspective. A large building sits to the southeast, and the road ends here at its patio. An open gate invites entry.  Other buildings are gathered to the north, beyond a small pond.  The road curves south through the hills.

rooms.name: Mountain Pass
rooms.description: High peaks loom on either side of this narrow winding pass.  Rocky outcroppings jut out above.  A scree of stones has slid down, almost blocking the way and forming a large pile to one side.  Twisted pines and larches cling to the hillsides, growing large in spite of the rarified air.

rooms.name: Mountain Pass
rooms.description: The brown stone of these mountains looms above.  Thick roots dig deep into the cracks as sharp-needled larches cling to life.  The way is twisted between the towering peaks, and a cold wind blows through to the south.

rooms.name: Mountain Pass
rooms.description: The pass narrows here as the mountains become tall and steep.  A deep forest of tall pines grows all around, drinking the cool air.  Needles and cones pile up and dry as the wind blows through.  The land rises to the south.

rooms.name: Mountain Trail
rooms.description: A path leads up from hills in the north to high mountains in the south. The air is dry but cool, and short trees grow among the scrubby bushes.  Gray and brown stones, flaking like slate, jut out from the earth at odd angles and form a clinky surface on which to walk.
